availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Executive Journal, 1859-1862

body.p:
7
The Governor Commissioned the following Majors of the Enrolled Militia Jas G. Malone, J. F Weller, J. W. Winter, Frank Madden, and Wm Campbell for Jefferson J W Penn, J. E Emerson, L. W. Holloway and J. H. C Bartlett for Scott County
Also Geo E Herrick as 3d Lieut of the Shelby Guards:
He approved accounts to John L. Moore & Son amounting to $142.33 certified by Librarian to be correct for articles furnished the Governors & Secretary's office.
He remitted the following Judgments, to wit:

row.cell: Green Cir. Ct. vs. Thompson & Kesler

body.p:
Feby 7
The Governor nominated to the Senate the following persons to be Notaries Public in the counties named:
James D. White and Chas Wickliffe for Ballard A Boyd for McCracken and Jese. Davidson for Greenup County which nominations were duly confirmed.
He approved and Signed enrolled bills Chapters 94 to 112 inclusive.
